reasons_to_visit.details: Experience Stockholm as it transitions from winter, potentially with lingering snow but increasing daylight. Enjoy major museums and indoor attractions with minimal crowds.
Benefit from lower prices for flights and accommodation compared to peak season, offering better value (outside potential Easter holidays).
Perfect weather to embrace the Swedish tradition of 'fika' – enjoying coffee and pastries (like 'semlor' before Easter) in warm, inviting cafés.
Celebrate Våffeldagen on March 25th! Indulge in traditional heart-shaped Swedish waffles served with jam and cream at cafés across the city.
Ideal conditions for in-depth exploration of Stockholm's excellent museums like the Vasa Museum, Skansen (winter/early spring program), ABBA Museum, Fotografiska, and Nationalmuseum.
Depending on conditions early in the month, there might still be opportunities for ice skating or enjoying the end of the ski season at nearby slopes.

reasons_to_reconsider.details: March remains cold (avg highs 3-6°C/37-43°F) and weather is highly variable. Expect potential for snow, rain, wind, and cold spells alongside sunny days. Requires proper winter/spring layering.
Daylight hours increase significantly throughout March but are still much shorter than summer, limiting time for extensive outdoor exploration.
Most archipelago islands and services are still in winter mode. Ferry services are limited, and many island businesses remain closed.
Melting snow and fluctuating temperatures can lead to icy and slushy conditions on streets and sidewalks. Good waterproof footwear with grip is essential.
If Easter falls in late March, Good Friday and Easter Monday are public holidays with widespread closures (shops, Systembolaget, some museums/restaurants). Check dates for the year.

weather.precipitation: Still feels like winter. High chance of snow or sleet/rain mix. Cold winds possible. Sunny days occur but are often crisp.
weather.general_tips: Pack warm winter clothing: thermal layers, insulated waterproof coat, hat, gloves, scarf, waterproof boots with good grip. Layers are key for adapting to changing conditions.

tourism_level.crowds: Low season continues. Attractions are quiet.
tourism_level.pricing: Generally good value for flights and accommodation.
tourism_level.overall_atmosphere: Late winter feel. Quiet city, focused on indoor activities. Potential for snow enhances charm but requires practical preparation.

events_holidays.name: Tempo Documentary Festival (Check Dates)
events_holidays.description: Sweden's largest documentary film festival, showcasing international and Swedish documentaries at various cinemas.
events_holidays.notes: Check the official Tempo website for exact dates and program. Many films have English subtitles.

events_holidays.name: Allt För Sjön (Boat Show - Check Dates)
events_holidays.date: Often spans two weeks in March
events_holidays.description: Major international boat show held at Stockholmsmässan (Stockholm International Fairs).
events_holidays.notes: Appeals to boating enthusiasts. Check exact dates and location.

unique_experiences.description: Dedicate time to the incredible 17th-century warship museum without the crowds of peak season.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Ideal indoor activity for cold or wet weather. Allow 2-3 hours.

unique_experiences.description: See the open-air museum's historic buildings (some may be closed internally) and Nordic animals in a quieter setting. Check for any early spring events.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Dress very warmly as much is outdoors. Check reduced winter/spring opening hours.

unique_experiences.description: Enjoy a traditional Swedish coffee break. March is often the last chance to find 'semlor' (Lenten cream buns) in bakeries before Easter.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Look for cafes known for good pastries ('konditori'). Many offer cozy indoor seating.

unique_experiences.where: Kungsträdgården (check closure dates), potentially other rinks
unique_experiences.description: Catch the very end of the outdoor ice skating season if rinks remain open into early March.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Check specific rink operating dates/hours as they close based on weather. Skate rentals available.

weather.precipitation: Signs of spring emerge. Increased chance of rain over snow, but snow/sleet still possible. More sunny days, longer daylight hours noticeable.
weather.general_tips: Continue layering, but perhaps slightly less heavy insulation needed on milder days. Waterproof outerwear and footwear remain crucial.

tourism_level.crowds: Remains relatively low, but may see a slight uptick towards Easter if it falls late in the month.
tourism_level.pricing: Shoulder season value continues, watch for potential Easter holiday price increases.
tourism_level.overall_atmosphere: Transition period. Feels less like deep winter. Brighter days, anticipation of spring. Waffle Day adds a fun local touch.

events_holidays.name: Waffle Day (Våffeldagen)
events_holidays.description: Celebrate the day dedicated to waffles! Cafés and homes serve crispy, heart-shaped Swedish waffles with jam (sylt) and whipped cream (grädde).
events_holidays.notes: Not a public holiday. A fun culinary tradition to participate in. Look for cafes advertising 'Våfflor'.

events_holidays.name: Easter Weekend (Potential - Check Dates)
events_holidays.description: If Easter occurs, Good Friday & Easter Monday are public holidays. Traditions include Easter eggs (often filled with candy), decorations with birch twigs and feathers ('påskris'), and specific foods.
events_holidays.notes: Check dates for the year. Expect closures on public holidays. Skansen often has Easter markets/activities.

unique_experiences.where: Cafés and 'Våffelstugor' (Waffle Cottages - may be seasonal)
unique_experiences.description: Indulge in delicious Swedish waffles on March 25th. Find a cozy café and enjoy this sweet tradition.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Popular cafes might be busier on this day. Try classic toppings like cloudberry jam ('hjortronsylt').

unique_experiences.activity: Explore Gamla Stan as Spring Approaches
unique_experiences.description: Wander the historic streets as the light gets stronger and the days longer. Less crowded than spring/summer.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Wear good footwear for potentially wet/icy cobblestones. Enjoy the architecture.

unique_experiences.description: Explore world-class photography exhibitions in a stunning waterfront building. Open late, good for extending shorter days.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Check current exhibitions. Top-floor café offers great views.

unique_experiences.description: Enjoy a refreshing walk on these quieter central islands, offering great views back towards Gamla Stan and Djurgården, potentially seeing ice break up on the water.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Home to Moderna Museet (Modern Art) and Östasiatiska museet (East Asian Antiquities). Dress warmly for wind off the water.
